page.title: 08FISHING/OVERTON+MIDDLETON
page.content: At one time,the main occupations of the villagers were farming and fishing.The Lune Estuary has given a living to some families for generations. "Haafing" is a method used only on the river Lune,and the Solent.It is a Viking method,using a long T-shaped frame net,which the fisherman,up to his waist in water,holds to catch fish on the incoming tide.Shrimps are caught in the Lune Deeps,in long pointed "wammel" nets.There is a salmon season,and a season for whitebait and sprats.Salmon used to be the most lucrative catch,but the rising cost of licences is killing off the trade.
